item.title: Running tests in parallel with Django and PyCharm
item.description: These days it is hard to come across any consumer device that only has one CPU-core. And even though most computers released during the last decade comes with multiple cores, there are plenty of software that defaults to non-parallel execution. The unittest package in Python’s standard library is sadly one of those. But there is still hope. The powerful pytest framework and Django’s own testing framework does support running test in parallel, which can vastly decrease the time required to run through a suite of tests.
